sentence.text: The 60-year-old brother of the paternal grandmother had mild brachycephaly, laterally sparse, “mephistophean” eyebrows, deep nasolabial folds, convex nasal ridge, mandibular prognathism, long ears with large lobules.
He had clinodactyly of his 2nd and 5th fingers, and clubbing of the distal phalanges.
Broad feet and great toes, apparently short metatarsal bones, short and irregularly placed toes, partial 2/3 syndactyly on the left foot were observed (Fig. 2M–P).
He has two daughters, the elder one has syndactylies on both feet, but she was not accessible for clinical examination.
